name: Ptolemy's Map of Britannia (c.150 AD / 1477 print)
description: Claudius Ptolemy's map of the British Isles from his Geographia (c.150 AD). First printed 1477 in Bologna. Shows Roman Britain including approximate location of Mancunium.
notes:
Ptolemy's Geographia written c.150 AD in Alexandria.
First printed edition: Bologna 1477.
Shows 'Mancunium' (Manchester's Roman fort) roughly positioned.
Multiple Renaissance printed editions: 1477, 1482, 1507, 1513, etc.

NLS 1525 edition: 'TABULA NOVA, HYBERNIAE, ANGLIAE, ET SCOTIAE'
https://maps.nls.uk/atlas/ptolemy/1525/browse/4900
NLS also has 1584 edition: https://maps.nls.uk/atlas/ptolemy/

BL Burney MS 111 (Greek MS, late 14th/15th c., 66 coloured maps):
Britannia folio at f.15r ('Ivernia insula Britannica').
BL images currently unavailable post-2023 cyber-attack.
Pelagios dataset (CC0): https://bl.iro.bl.uk/concern/datasets/111ed9c8-1de7-4af5-a85d-842e119a47d9
DOI: doi.org/10.21250/pel05
Wikimedia: https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/Category:Burney_MS_111
